meanings.definition: The state or quality of being serious and dignified.
meanings.sent1: The solemnity of the judge's expression made everyone quiet in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: The solemnity of the occasion called for everyone to behave respectfully.
meanings.sent3: The solemnity of the clown's performance was unexpected but oddly fitting.
meanings.sent4: The solemnity of the mountain peak at sunrise was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The solemnity of the library filled the air with a sense of reverence.

meanings.definition: A formal, dignified, or serious ceremony or observance.
meanings.sent1: The graduation ceremony was filled with solemnity as students received their diplomas.
meanings.sent2: The solemnity of the royal wedding was evident in every detail of the event.
meanings.sent3: The solemnity of the birthday party surprised the guests who expected a casual gathering.
meanings.sent4: The solemnity of the courtroom proceedings added weight to the verdict.
meanings.sent5: The solemnity of the funeral service brought tears to many eyes.
